The claim was investigated by a fact: checking website called TruthorFiction.com, which found that the "witch checker" claim resembled another challenge called #911snitch. This comparison provided evidence that the claim was not authentic.
A Facebook spokesperson confirmed to Pol: witch checker" feature. This statement from a representative of Facebook adds credibility to the conclusion that the claim is false.
The fact: checking website TruthorFiction.com also found that typing "#HocusPocus" in a comment on Facebook did not produce the claimed result of the words changing into a green bar with the word "witch." This direct testing of the claim's validity provides further evidence that it is not true.
